Title: Mathematician at Heart
Description: I've always been inticed with mathematics, i knew I was always simply a math guy. In my final year of undergrad, I transitioned from Computer Engineering to Applied Mathematics because I knew I wanted to take the opporunitity to finish my undergrad education developing the mathamatical maturity to describe the systems I would encounter with the understanding I will be able to aquire the skills to develop said systems through personal and professional practice. The projects in my portfolio and professional experience thus far expresses that pursuit.

Title: Full-Stack Engineer by Trade
Description: Just because an answer is right does not mean that it is correct. Lessons learned at my first role at Proplogix maintaining a legacy CakePHP project then contributing to a .NET CORE web application, I know that designing a solution that fits a project's paradigm is different than just developing a correct answer that meets requirements. Through practical experience brings the intuition to differentiate the two.

Title: Tutoring as a Mutualistic Relationship.
Description: The best way to learn is by conveying information in a way that is digestable to others. I've practiced peer tutoring since highschool, and managed to follow the route to be able to work as a math tutor as a job throughout college and til this day as a private tutor through people in my circle and as a agent with Coding with Kids here in Austin.

Title: Manga for the Win
Description: My current hobby is catching up on all the greats that manga has to offer. GO READ VAGABOND || HUMONCULUS!

Title: We are Human
Description: We create becuase we are drawn to things that we feel challenged to do. I am a lifter, a fraternity brother, a family man, most importantly I am human. My reason to be here? I just want to make cool sh*t!
